trait.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the Dung Eater can regain 20 hit points.

trait.name: The Dung Eater Curse
entries: When hitting a creature other than an undead or construct, Dung Eater deals a mortal wound. The target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or lose {@dice 1d10} hit points at the start of its turn. Each time the Dung Eater attacks the target with the wound, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10}. Any creature can take an action to stop the wound with a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dung eater fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Dung Eater makes three attacks with its greatsword or its shortbow.

action.name: Sword Of Milos
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic or radiant damage (See below)

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if the champion has more than half of its total hit points remaining.

action.name: Shriek of Milos (1/day)
entries: The Dung Eater lets out a horrible, cursed scream that removes resistances from all creatures within 20 feet (except itself) the effect lasts for 24 hours or until the target receives remove curse.

In addition, the Sword of Milos takes {@damage 2d6} radiant or necrotic damage, the Dung Eater can choose the damage before the attack roll is made. If choosing radiant, the target, if hit, must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of Dung's next turn, if choosing necrotic, the target must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or gain the Dung Eater's curse, cannot receive magical or non-magical healing, and suffers disadvantage on Strength, Constitution, and Dexterity saving throws.

Champions are mighty warriors who honed their fighting skills in wars or gladiatorial pits. To soldiers and other people who fight for a living, champions are as influential as nobles, and their presence is courted as a sign of status among rulers.

reaction.name: Pearldrake Talisman
entries: The Dung Eater cast {@spell Absorb Elements}
